meanings.definition: Not capable of living, growing, or developing successfully.
meanings.sent1: The tiny, unviable plant struggled to survive in the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The scientist concluded that the experiment was unviable due to lack of resources.
meanings.sent3: The unviable seed thought it could grow into a giant tree overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a famous singer seemed unviable, like a ship without a sail.
meanings.sent5: The unviable plan to build a house without any materials quickly fell apart.

meanings.definition: Not capable of working, functioning, or succeeding.
meanings.sent1: The old, unviable computer could no longer run any programs.
meanings.sent2: The team realized their strategy was unviable after losing multiple games.
meanings.sent3: The unviable clock decided to stop ticking just for fun.
meanings.sent4: His unviable attempt to fix the leaky faucet only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The unviable business model was like a broken machine, unable to generate profit.
